channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Zebra crossing light cover loose, 22nd January
item.description:
The cover on the central zebra crossing light at Brampton Road has yet again moved round, meaning the light is now flashing directly in our bedrooms at night. Can this be rectified again, and make a more permanent fix than previous attempts.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brampton Road, West Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping, 22nd January
item.description:
Lots of rubbish dumped here.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 84, Moncrieff Street, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Big potholes., 22nd January
item.description:
My house is adjacent to multiple potholes. When vans, trucks and buses hit it my house shakes. Every few minutes. This is a repeating problem. Please fix the road properly, instead of ineffective, inefficient, multiple patch up jobs. These must surely cost more than just doing it properly once.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Longland Drive, Woodside Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging vegetation from private houses impede pavement access, 22nd January
item.description:
Overhanging vegetation particularly 29 and 31 Garden Road and round the corner into Lawn Close impede pavement access for pedestrians (especially with umbrellas), prams and mobility scooters etc. This has been problem for months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Garden Road, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flashing street light, 22nd January
item.description:
This street light located on Maritime street has began rapidly flashing on and off within the last few hours. It is very distracting and has me worried that it could become an even bigger problem if left unresolved. There is also reports from people living in the local area that it is causing headaches for people who work from home.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woodland Crescent, Rotherhithe, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Damage - pole leaning / equipment detached from pole/facing the wrong direction

item.title: Blocked drain, 22nd January
item.description:
This drain has been blocked with soil for the last 3 years where grass would grow during the summer. To my surprise today, now it's blocked with tarmac. When it rains the water doesn't go anywhere and it creates a hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clapham Common North Side, Clapham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Roof has been smashed, glass all over pavement and road, 22nd January
item.description:
I just drove back and I live in the building next door but with the shared car park. Have no idea how this happened but itâ€™s clearly a bit of a hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 305, Rotherhithe Street, Rotherhithe, Greater London

item.title: Abandoned zip cars with flats, 22nd January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Jasper Road, Greater London

item.title: Pothole, 22nd January
item.description:
This pothole outside 266 Fulham Road, SW10, seems to have been repaired but the repair is failing badly - many buses and lorries travel over it and it has only been getting worse in the past couple of weeks. It would be hugely dangerous were a cyclist or motorbike rider were unable to avoid it and is on a red route that is constantly busy.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 262a, Fulham Road, Brompton, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
